title: Add playable AI-generated games to Games category

requirements.text: Implement a backend endpoint that generates playable game code (HTML/CSS/JavaScript) based on game metadata (title, category, description)

quotes: in the games catigory make it so  there are real fun games you can acually play that the ai made

acceptanceCriteria: Backend function accepts game metadata and returns complete HTML/CSS/JavaScript code for a playable game
Generated games are simple, functional, and playable in a browser
Game code includes basic mechanics appropriate to the game type (puzzle, arcade, strategy, etc.)

requirements.text: Update GamePlayer component to render AI-generated game code in an iframe or sandboxed container

quotes: there are real fun games you can acually play

acceptanceCriteria: GamePlayer fetches and displays generated game code when user clicks play
Games run in a secure sandbox (iframe with sandbox attributes)
Game controls and interactions work within the player interface

requirements.text: Create a library of playable game templates that the AI can generate: simple arcade games (Snake, Pong variants), puzzle games (Tic-Tac-Toe, Memory Match), and reaction games (Whack-a-Mole, Color Match)

quotes: real fun games you can acually play that the ai made

acceptanceCriteria: At least 5 different game templates are available for generation
Each game type has clear rules, win/lose conditions, and score tracking
Games are responsive and work on different screen sizes

requirements.text: Update the game catalogue in useGameCatalogue hook to mark games as playable and integrate with the game generation backend
acceptanceCriteria: Game cards display 'Play Now' for AI-generated playable games
Clicking play loads the generated game code in GamePlayer
Loading states are shown while games are being generated or loaded

requirements.text: Add game state persistence so that generated games can save and load player progress (scores, levels, game state)
acceptanceCriteria: Games can save state to backend between sessions
High scores and progress are preserved across browser sessions
Users can resume games from where they left off

constraints: Generated game code must be safe and sandboxed to prevent security issues
Games must not require external dependencies or CDN resources
Game generation must complete within reasonable time (under 3 seconds)
nonGoals: Integration with external game APIs or services
